c:
Why is OE a necessary evil...

when there's Thunderbird!?

I've been using Thunderbird on my win boxes and my Powerbook, since 0.3. It's been a great replacement for Outlook and OE. I only wish for calendaring integration :(

OE is necessary because...

It's actually pretty good for an IMAP client. Nothing else compares (even though OE does suck in many other ways), and I don't trust beta software with my mail; a friend of mine recently lost all their mail to one of these Moz spin-offs.

Prevent it from running

On Windows XP, you can prevent msmsgs.exe from running using gpedit.msc. If you want more specific instructions, email me.
